TopicTitle: Fastest One Engine only landing on Vehicle Assembly Building.

Articles.Content:
Rules:

-One engine only and don't lose parts, that's it.

-Post a picture of your craft intact on the roof + F3 shot for the details.

-Drones can enter.

Example:

![fymvq8j.png](http://i.imgur.com/fymvq8j.png)

![xvT3ksg.png](http://i.imgur.com/xvT3ksg.png)

![bBKwDZT.png](http://i.imgur.com/bBKwDZT.png)

![JANMglo.png](http://i.imgur.com/JANMglo.png)

![j5EqAmW.png](http://i.imgur.com/j5EqAmW.png)

craft used (stock, no mods):

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/sv8r1pcjkpql8rh/VTOL%203.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/sv8r1pcjkpql8rh/VTOL%203.craft?dl=0)

 **LEADERBOARD**

**FASTEST:**

1. Aphobius 6 sec. Start from launchpad.(drone)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/OpzQm6JLa4s?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

2. Romphaia 16 sec. Start from launchpad.(**3** Kerbals !)

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jb-G51hsZIw?start=21&feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

**LOWEST PART COUNT:**

1. Romphaia 5 parts. 

2. Aphobius 10 parts.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/sv8r1pcjkpql8rh/VTOL%203.craft?dl=0

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T18:31:14Z" title="06/24/2015 06:31  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by Triop**

Can I start from the launchpad rather than the runway?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T09:14:33Z" title="06/24/2015 09:14  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by Teilnehmer**

> 
> Can I start from the launchpad rather than the runway?

Yes, you can.
I might enter this, please no ground supports, as they would count as losing parts.

You didn't say it had to be a soft landing.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vO-DnrzzMYE?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

17 seconds, 5 parts

![xx9g5rS.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/xx9g5rS.jpg)

Nice job and very fast Rhomphaia !

I will put your name on the leaderboard.

> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/xx9g5rS.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/xx9g5rS.jpg)
> Nice job and very fast Rhomphaia !
> 
> I will put your name on the leaderboard.

And here I was expecting 'Chutes to be disqualified. So I made a soft lander and beat my own time by a second.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jb-G51hsZIw?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

8 parts

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T16:25:28Z" title="06/24/2015 04:25  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by Rhomphaia**

> 
> And here I was expecting 'Chutes to be disqualified. So I made a soft lander and beat my own time by a second.
> [http://youtu.be/jb-G51hsZIw](https://youtu.be/jb-G51hsZIw)
> 
> 8 parts

Cool !

I will update the leaderboard.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/OpzQm6JLa4s?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

6 seconds, 10 parts

> 
> <iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/OpzQm6JLa4s?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
> 
> 6 seconds, 10 parts

![xx9g5rS.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/xx9g5rS.jpg)

I did not think that was even possible !

You did not use F3 for the proper timeset, but the video clearly shows a 6 sec. landing so I will pass this.

I don't think any more people wanna compete now...![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)...Unless you will give us your craftfile so we can try to beat your time (rules don't say anything about building the craft yourself or copy designs.)

I wil give it a new category for pilot skills.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T21:38:55Z" title="06/24/2015 09:38  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by Triop**
You can easily replicate it, the only part that might not be clear ... I use that toroidal fuel tank between the reaction wheels.

> 
> You can easily replicate it, the only part that might not be clear ... I use that toroidal fuel tank between the reaction wheels.

Lol, I use that trick aswell.

Sometimes even stack a few of them.
